section.title: SimME - @berlios
section.p: What does this stand for? Simulator MicroEdition. In fact this project develops a two player game for Java 2 MicroEdition. The game is based on a strategy game which can be found at www.dbai.tuwien.ac.at/proj/ramsey (the simulator). The game will be played via mobile phone against any other person around the globe.
A community page will be set up, providing rankings, stats and a possibility to match up. More on this soon.

section.title: General Information
section.p:
This is the main web page with some current information on the project. The most current version is 0.0.5. You can download the release files from the files page. Alternatively point your mobile phone to
www.einspiel.at
in order to download the game directly to your phone.
Note: the above URL is a WAP page and may be displayed incorrectly in some browsers.
More information can be found at our wiki page.

section.title: Current Development
section.p: We are currently working hard on our next release. For the curious: have a look at the project's CVS web interface. Although some comments are in German, we tried to keep all javadoc in English.

The project is split into two parts. One part builds the client side which uses the MIDP-1.0 and CLDC-1.0 specification. The other part develops the server side which uses JSPs/Servlets (where we don't have that much experience). The two parts communicate via XML over HTTP.

Currently the development process is held very close but the project will soon be opened after we have created something someone else could use. There is a short introduction on the development environment. Although it is not current, there are some links that can get you started.

section.p: A lot of thanks go to Berlios who host the development pages of this project.
